Legal_Issue: Admissibility of evidence (letters and affidavit portions) prior to trial or summary judgment
Evidence_Assessment: Letters and affidavit portions subject to admissibility challenge
Decision_Outcome: Motion denied; admissibility to be decided by summary motions judge with full context
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiffs to justify pre-trial determination of admissibility
Credibility_Factor: Contextual relevance of evidence emphasized by defendants
Legal_Rule: Rule 474(1)(b) permits pre-trial determination of evidence admissibility if expedient
Standard_of_Review: Judicial discretion based on expediency and case context
Procedural_Issue: Whether evidentiary rulings can be made before trial under rule 474(1)(b)
Grounds_for_Claim: Defendants' alleged unauthorized use of LEGO trademark
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided; procedural motion addressed only
Review_Standard: Expediency and established case law precedent
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Full context needed for fair decision; premature ruling avoided
Legal_Framework: Federal Court Rules, Canadian civil procedure
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs sought pre-trial exclusion of evidence
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (implied in civil context)
Defendant_Response: Agreed letters inadmissible for showing case weakness but argued context matters
Outcome: Request denied, cost award to defendants
Remedy_Sought: Exclusion of evidence prior to trial
Legal_Provision: Rule 474(1)(b) of the Federal Court Rules
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Evidence may be prejudicial or lack proper context if ruled on prematurely
Applicable_Process: Pre-trial motion process for evidentiary rulings
Outcome_of_Review: Admissibility deferred to summary judgment stage
